components.description:
A waning crescent moon (appearing to become smaller), the last of the phases of the moon. Depicts the moon as a cratered disc, its left side illuminated in a thin, golden or silver crescent, its remainder dark.

May be used to represent the moon more generally, nighttime, outer space, and astronomy. May also be used to convey enchanting or eerie feelings.

In July 2023 this emoji trended on Emojipedia. This is likely due to it being required to complete developer Neal Agarwal’s viral hit The Password Game.

See also üåô Crescent Moon. Not to be confused with üåí Waxing Crescent Moon, though their applications may overlap. Used as part of the Moon Emoji Creep meme.

Samsung’s design once resembled a full moon with stars and previously displayed as a waning crescent moon in a night sky with stars.
components.title: Waning Crescent Moon Symbol

description:

May be used to represent the moon more generally, nighttime, outer space, and astronomy. May also be used to convey enchanting or eerie feelings.

In July 2023 this emoji trended on Emojipedia. This is likely due to it being required to complete developer Neal Agarwal’s viral hit The Password Game.

See also üåô Crescent Moon. Not to be confused with üåí Waxing Crescent Moon, though their applications may overlap. Used as part of the Moon Emoji Creep meme.

title: Waning Crescent Moon Symbol

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Moon, sun, and star symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: Waning Crescent Moon was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name ‚ÄúWaning Crescent Moon Symbol‚Äù and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015 http://emojipedia.org/waning-crescent-moon-symbol/
emoji_net_data.name: waning crescent moon

bn:00113695a: (of the Moon) pertaining to the period during which the visible surface of the moon decreases

bn:00100902a: Devoid of or deficient in light or brightness; shadowed or black
Having an absolute or (more often) relative lack of light.
Having an absolute or relative lack of light.

bn:00025236n: Night or nighttime is the period of time between the sunset and the sunrise when the Sun is below the horizon.
The time after sunset and before sunrise while it is dark outside
The period between sunset and sunrise, when a location faces far away from the sun, thus when the sky is dark.
Night is the period of time when the sun is below the horizon.
Part of the day when the Sun is not aloft
The hours of darkness between sunset and sunrise; the night.

bn:00023749n: Any shape resembling the curved shape of the moon in its first or last quarters
Crescent is a solitaire card game played with two decks of playing cards mixed together.

bn:00034794n: Any one of the aspects or appearances presented by the moon as seen from Earth.
The waxing lunar phase, from new moon to half way between new moon and full moon.
A lunar phase either side of the full moon when the moon's disc as seen from the Earth is larger than a semicircle.
The waning lunar phase half way between full moon and new moon.
The lunar phase or phase of the moon is the shape of the illuminated portion of the Moon as seen by an observer, usually on Earth.
Appearance of the illuminated (sunlit) portion of the Moon as seen by an observer
The phase of the moon when it is waning.
The first fourth of the Moon's period of revolution around the Earth
The moon when it appears smaller each night as it progresses from a full moon to a new moon.
The moon when it appears larger each night as it progresses from a new moon to a full moon.

bn:00072101n: A natural and periodic state of rest during which consciousness of the world is suspended
A periodic state of physiological rest during which consciousness is suspended and metabolic rate is decreased.
The state of reduced consciousness during which a human or animal rests in a daily rhythm.
Sleep is a naturally recurring state of bodily rest involving altered consciousness, relatively inhibited sensory activity, and inhibition of nearly all voluntary muscles.
State characterized by reduced or absent consciousness
In animals, sleep is a naturally recurring state characterized by altered consciousness, relatively inhibited sensory activity, and inhibition of nearly all voluntary muscles.

bn:00029648n: An eclipse is an astronomical event that occurs when an astronomical object is temporarily obscured, either by passing into the shadow of another body or by having another body pass between it and the viewer.

An astronomical event that occurs when one celestial object is hidden by another celestial object that passes between it and the observer when the nearer object appears larger and completely hides the more distant object

An alignment of astronomical objects in which a planetary object (for example, the Moon) comes between the Sun and another planetary object (for example, the Earth), resulting in a shadow being cast by the middle planetary object onto the other planetary object.
Passage of a planetary object between others.
An occultation is an event that occurs when one object is hidden by another object that passes between it and the observer.
Astronomical event where one body hides another
A type of alignment, in which a planetary object comes between the sun and another planetary object.

bn:00031998n: "Abide with Me" is a Christian hymn by Scottish Anglican Henry Francis Lyte most often sung to English composer William Henry Monk's tune entitled "Eventide".
The latter part of the day (the period of decreasing daylight from late afternoon until nightfall)
Period of the day between 5:00 pm and 9:00 pm
The evening before a certain day.
Evening is the period between the late afternoon and night when daylight is decreasing, around dinner time.
The time of the day between the approximate time of midwinter dusk and midnight (compare afternoon); the period after the end of regular office working hours.
That part of the day in which daylight decreases and the night falls.
Evening in its primary meaning is the period of the day between afternoon and night.

bn:00055809n: Any substantially sized natural satellite of a planet.
The sole natural satellite of the Earth.
The natural satellite of the Earth
The first planet from Earth in the Ptolemaic geocentric model
The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite.

bn:00062777n: A barcoding system for sorting mail used by the US Postal Service
Any celestial body (other than comets or satellites) that revolves around a star
The Postal Alpha Numeric Encoding Technique barcode is used by the United States Postal Service to identify and track pieces of mail during delivery - the Post Office's "CONFIRM" services.

bn:00023747n: Twilight is the time between dawn and sunrise, and the time between sunset and dusk.
A period of time at the end of the day shortly after sunset during which the light fades gradually.
Twilight, as at early morning or (especially) early evening; dusk
The darkest stage of twilight in the evening
The time when this light is visible; the period between daylight and darkness.
"Nightfall" is a 1941 science fiction short story by Isaac Asimov about the coming of darkness to the people of a planet ordinarily illuminated at all times on all sides.
A 1941 science fiction short story by Isaac Asimov, and later adaptations
The time of day immediately following sunset
A period of time occurring at the end of the day during which the sun sets.

Evenfall is the first short film in a series about a highly trained young woman embarking on her career as an international spy and discovering it takes more than good looks to keep things from falling into the wrong hands.
Dusk is the darkest stage of twilight in the evening.
The time between dawn and sunrise or between sunset and dusk
Twilight is the illumination of the Earth's lower atmosphere when the Sun itself is not directly visible because it is below the horizon.
The close of the day; the coming of night.
